title: Small Farm Irrigation - Video 1 - How to Attach a Lay Flat Header Pipe to a Garden Hose Faucet

tasks.task: Attach a lay flat header pipe to a regular garden hose for a basic irrigation system.
subtasks: Use a clamp with a gray barbed connector on a lay flat header.
Apply vegetable oil as lubricant if needed.
Tighten the clamp with pipe wrenches.
Wrap Teflon tape clockwise around 2-inch male PVC coupler threads.
Screw the PVC coupler into the gray barbed connector.
Apply PVC glue to 3/4-inch female reduced threads and 2-inch male coupler.
Wrap 3/4-inch female connector threads with Teflon tape, then screw into the reducer.
Apply PVC glue to 3/4-inch pipe sections.
Attach a valve with directionality ensured by checking the arrow.
Add Teflon tape to clean water hose or faucet threads.
Consider attaching a fertigation system in the center pipe.

tasks.task: ** Attaches a lay flat header pipe to a regular garden hose for an irrigation system.
Attach a lay flat header pipe to a regular garden hose.
subtasks: Use a clamp to attach a gray barbed connector to the lay flat header; if necessary, apply vegetable oil as lubricant, then tighten with pipe wrenches.
Wrap Teflon tape clockwise around the threads of a 2-inch male PVC coupler.
Screw the PVC coupler into the gray barbed connector.
Apply PVC glue to the threads of a 3/4-inch female reduced threaded piece and a 2-inch male PVC coupler.
Wrap Teflon tape around the threads of a 3/4-inch female connector and screw it into the reducer.
Apply more PVC glue to connect a short piece of 3/4-inch PVC pipe.
Attach a valve, ensuring correct direction by checking the arrow on the valve.
Apply PVC glue to connect another short piece of PVC pipe and a 3/4-inch female connector.
Add Teflon tape to the clean threads of the water hose or faucet.
Consider adding a fertigation system in the center of the pipe.
